intro: Senecio polylepis, commonly known as the Bolivian groundsels, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia and Peru. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are generally hairy and narrow, while its yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters. Senecio polylepis plays a role in local ecosystems and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
